TopicTitle: Will my Laptop run KSP decently?

Articles.Content:
Hey, I recently just bought a laptop on sale and I am wondering if it can run KSP (even on minimum settings) with little to no lag? I dont play alot of games but I play a lot of KSP so I really hope its good enough

[url]http://www.pcworld.ie/Product/hp-15ac151sa-156-laptop-silver/329303/396.0.0[/url]

It has the following:

-8 GB RAM
-2 TB HDD
-Intel Core i3-5020U


I know it does not meet the recommended specs but I believe it surpasses the minimum requirements.
Just looking at the provided specs your laptop, you will probably not be able to comfortably play ksp
I play it happily enough with an i3 with 4GB of RAM. It starts to lag noticeably at about 150 parts. I use tweakscale to keep part numbers down.
Thanks for the answer, If it doesn't work out for me I can go with plan B (getting KSP for PS4 when its out)

You should be just fine. I've tested multiple versions of KSP on my old low-end laptop and the game plays just fine. Might have to slightly lower the graphics settings a tiny bit, but you should have no major problems. If it runs sluggish, close other running processes and/or lower settings.

[quote name='peadar1987']I play it happily enough with an i3 with 4GB of RAM. It starts to lag noticeably at about 150 parts. I use tweakscale to keep part numbers down.[/QUOTE]

'An i3' is about as descriptive as 'a red car' when it comes to performance.
